Perform parallel benchmarks on a function

Source: R/utils.R
par_benchmark.Rd

Perform parallel benchmarks on a function

par_benchmark(CPUS, FUN, plot = FALSE, quiet = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

CPUS

vector with the number of CPUs
FUN

parallel function, MUST have a parameter called cpus
plot

boolean flag to request a plot for the results
quiet

boolean flag to print results of each execution
...

optional arguments for the function, must be named; e.g. x = test_df

Examples

# Define toy function that sleeps for (2/cpus) seconds
a <- function(cpus) {Sys.sleep(2/cpus)}
par_benchmark(c(1, 2), a)

#> Using 1 CPUs: 2.042 sec elapsed
#> Using 2 CPUs: 1.023 sec elapsed
#>   cpus times
#> 1    1 2.042
#> 2    2 1.023
# \donttest{
par_benchmark(c(1, 2), a, plot = TRUE)

#> Using 1 CPUs: 2.002 sec elapsed
#> Using 2 CPUs: 1.063 sec elapsed
#>   cpus times
#> 1    1 2.002
#> 2    2 1.063
# }
